urls.title: icon/search
urls.description: The autumn 2019 issue of Wood Wise dispels any myths about deadwood and raises awareness of its importance to people and wildlife.

tweets.text:
#DidYouKnow that wood is a vital component of river health? Woody debris is a fantastic habitat for wildlife, and is an easy way to naturally restore degraded river catchments.

Learn more in our Wood Wise journal: https://t.co/ZhT7tPsoAC #WorldRiversDay https://t.co/gMlstfvMea

Rivers are vital to our environment. We respond to an environmental incident every 45 minutes to stop and reverse damage to our rivers. 
 
Let's work together to protect them. 
 
#WorldRiversDay https://t.co/0d3EzXd2ic

That moment when the water starts to flow in your newly-created, meandering river channel!  üåä üéâ Phase 1 of our river restoration project at Thrimby Grange in partnership with the landowner and @EnvAgencyNW, with support from @networkrail . Design @AquaUoS #WorldRiversDay https://t.co/kw1LPtj5vL

tweets.text: @mrstevefarris @EnvAgency Surfed the Severn Bore last week. First entry point was next to an abattoir on the river. Absolutely stank! Second entry point was by a Sewage outflow, which also stank. As the bore rolled past masses of human rubbish was washed along the banks!  Our rivers are in crisis! https://t.co/4ZLHwGjUo4

Our beautiful rivers are in crisis. Recent @EnvAgency data showed none of England's rivers are in good overall health üò®
We're grateful to all our volunteers who dedicate time to helping our rivers, but we need more govt. regulation to combat this crisis #WorldRiversDay üëä https://t.co/6MZ0vxjiXq
@EnvAgency Do something with this one then... https://t.co/dPYg9GfJuw
@EnvAgency This is the biggest load of cobblers you have ever come up with.  The EA has presided over the greatest decline in the quality of rivers for a century.  You should be ashamed of yourselves

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency How can any organisation set up to protect and conserve our water and environment .....sit back and say ‚Äúwe are powerless to stop High Speed 2‚Äù! #RiversDay2020 https://t.co/j2UigZkqjr

tweets.text: @imkegoal @HodgeHillResid1 @EnvAgencyMids Thanks @imkegoal. Much appreciated.
Part of the fence around the Bromford flood defence works in Birmingham has fallen down. It's at the Eastern edge of the area concerned. @EnvAgencyMids @CllrMajid https://t.co/NLAh6ZqUWq

Work is well underway at #Twerton #Bath for the arrival of the crane tomorrow at Weston Lock to lift and inspect boats. The canal towpath, roughly between the Locksbrook Inn and the west of Lock House on Brassmill Lane will remain closed for a period of 4 weeks. https://t.co/BzBRTI11ZM

We‚Äôve been restoring the River Camel near Bodmin - removing artificial structures from the river, improving fish passage and enhancing floodplain habitat. Grogley Weir has been removed, and we‚Äôve been adding woody material to the river to improve the habitat.#WorldRiversDay https://t.co/E4RZJhFrEi
@HodgeHillResid1 @CllrMajid @EnvAgencyMids Thanks. I have let the site manager know and hope he can see to it ASAP.

@imkegoal @CllrMajid @EnvAgencyMids Thanks for the quick responses. It's just before where there is a pedestrian path leading to the A452 Chester Road under the M6 motorway, i.e. at the extreme Eastern edge of where the work is taking place.
Our Site Controller is on site working with the @HumbersideFire https://t.co/mpwNcNnTQB

A very special visit last week from Marcus @MumfordAndSons to the #LakeDistrict river restoration projects delivered by @ullswatercic in partnership with @EnvAgency and @herdyshepherd. 

Our rivers are no longer a #HoplessWanderer ‚Ä¶ #IWillWait for a better pun. https://t.co/SpTSapbOsd

urls.description: Swindale is a valley in the eastern edge of the Lake District. It‚Äôs one of two farms where the RSPB are working together with water company United Utilities ...

tweets.text:
This #WorldRiversDay is more important than ever. Last week @EnvAgency figures revealed that 0% of rivers and lakes in England are classed as in good health. ZERO. 

It‚Äôs never been more crucial to support action for natures recovery üëâ https://t.co/zup3vrsuz7 #WilderFuture https://t.co/ll0pdflpI9
@WendyBowkett @djsisson55 @EnvAgencyMids @NRobinsonEA @johncurtinEA @RiverAndCoast They work hard, long hours and it‚Äôs freezing on the river
@CllrMajid @HodgeHillResid1 @EnvAgencyMids Thank you for letting us know. where abouts has it come down?
@HodgeHillResid1 @EnvAgencyMids @imkegoal can you kindly let the team know that the fence has come down urgently. Many thanks üëçüèæ

There are approximately 240,600km of rivers and streams in England.

Read our blog on the work we do to deliver the protection and enhancement they need üëá

https://t.co/QLZ8HSZI35

urls.title: Shocking state of English rivers revealed as all of them fail pollution tests
urls.description: Data reveals just 14% of good ecological standard and none of good chemical standard

tweets.text: The Ness, Aveyron & Ouse. I love a river but this recent article highlights the need to be more respectful to our precious natural resources. https://t.co/KBFPtozMeF #WorldRiversDay ‚Å¶@EnvAgency‚Å© https://t.co/DS3XrDYMgl

Dear @OfficialFCTA  @DrRamatuAliyu @MBuhari and @FMWHNIG this is a terrible state of the road and bridge which has brought suffering to the affected community in #TungaSarki of DAFA WARD in kwali area council, kindly come to their aid. https://t.co/rHKq4llrUm

tweets.text:
3/3 Rivers in virtually every country face many threats. Only through our active involvement can we ensure their health in future. 
We must care and protect our precious rivers. 
RT if you agree!
@EnvAgencyMids @TrentCaba @StaffsWildlife @SoTCityCouncil @NewsNBC @Britnatureguide

The @EnvAgency has also failed on waste incineration - handing out permits like sweets for incinerators, such as the 660,000 tonnes per year Rivenhall incinerator in rural north Essex to pump out toxic CO2 from the UK‚Äôs shortest smoke stack at 35 metres. https://t.co/K9BEX4rqj8

Have you seen the latest plans for the #Preston and South #Ribble #Flood Risk Management Scheme? You can check them out and give feedback on our new online engagement platform: https://t.co/fS0u63mpyK https://t.co/3yAVpoNhxL

.@EnvAgencySW are preparing for the arrival of the crane at Weston Lock to lift and inspect boats. 

https://t.co/1AHGmsf5qT
Cold and blustery morning walk on the River Bank to see the desilting boat at work on the Steeping  @djsisson55 @EnvAgencyMids @NRobinsonEA @johncurtinEA @RiverAndCoast https://t.co/4T4Jl6k29z

Q: Where shall we build a massive incinerator? 
A: Next to the beautiful River Ribble in Preston - and only 440m from homes & schools! ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èü§¶ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
#WorldRiversDay @EnvAgencyNW #StopPrestonIncinerator üî•üè≠üò∑ https://t.co/5fSXhW8480

A big surge in rivers being adopted by pressure groups. If you know of an orphaned river take it under your wings. The good people at @AquiferChalk are creating a tool kit for you. We need more of you because the @EnvAgency under current senior management are useless.

@EnvAgency woefully inadequate regulation, aside if you‚Äôre going to spend our money on PR films, please at least share meaningful information that actually helps people make a difference. This is pap.

Day 48.
For 48 days, I have posted about toxic and dangerous #PFAS and #PFOS chemicals in UK waters.
Hoping for voices to amplify and investigate.

Nothing so far.

'I told you so' is not what I want.

 @EnvAgency @DefraWater @GeorgeMonbiot @carolecadwalla @BBCNews @Channel4News

tweets.text: We are currently arguing with the @EnvAgency about how they categorise and count sewage discharges. They are digging their heels in and now suggest damp ground is an acceptable reason to discharge sewage.
@EnvAgency No so vital that you aren‚Äôt prepared to allow them to be destroyed! #RiversDay2020 #WorldsRiversDay https://t.co/aRYS0chphH

Boaters update : Marsh Lock has a fault and is only operating on handwind. EA Engineer scheduled to attend first thing tomorrow morning Apologises for any inconvenience caused. @thamesmobo @MarkHill03 @EnvAgencySE @wifo_ea @TW11Harbour
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Why did Southern Water directors not get prosecuted for knowingly discharging raw sewage ? The fine was paid from shareholder funds! see guardian for reference
